subject: p11569093
Findings: Comparison is made to prior study performed a day earlier. There has been interval marked enlargement of left pleural effusion that is layering and probably moderate. There is also increase in size in moderate right pleural effusion. Cardiac size cannot be evaluated. It is obscured by pleural parenchymal abnormalities. ET tube is in standard position. NG tube tip is in a distended stomach. Left IJ catheter tip is in the mid SVC. There is no evident pneumothorax. There is worsening of bibasilar atelectasis larger on the right side. There is persistent elevation of the right hemidiaphragm. There is mild pulmonary edema.
